I will punish the world for evil/wicked for their iniquity. The world is synonymous with wickedness (John 1:10-11; 15:18; JS 1:4). God is the agent of the destruction mentioned here, the wicked are the recipients of the destruction, and iniquity is the cause of the judgments.

arrogancy of the proud/haughtiness of the terrible. Arrogancy, haughtiness, and pride are often connected in the scriptures (2:11; 16:6; 1 Sam. 2:3; Prov. 8:13; Jer. 48:29). President Ezra Taft Benson taught that "pride is characterized by 'What do I want out of life?' rather than by 'What would God have me do with my life?' It is self-will as opposed to God's will. It is the fear of man over the fear of God." The terrible are those who are ruthless or tyrannical in dealing with others.
